faqs.question: Where is the clinic located?
faqs.answer: We are located at 123 Medical Center Drive, Suite 200, Springfield, IL 62701. We're in the Medical Arts Building, next to Springfield General Hospital.

faqs.question: Is there parking available?
faqs.answer: Yes! We have free parking in the underground garage with accessible spots near the elevator. Street parking is also available with 2-hour limits.

faqs.question: How do I get to your office?
faqs.answer: Enter the Medical Arts Building through the main lobby, take the elevator to the 2nd floor, and our clinic is in Suite 200. Signs will guide you from the elevator.

faqs.question: What are your hours of operation?
faqs.answer: We're open Monday-Thursday 8AM-6PM, Friday 8AM-5PM, and Saturday 9AM-1PM. We're closed on Sundays.

faqs.question: Are you open on weekends?
faqs.answer: Yes, we're open on Saturdays from 9AM to 1PM. We're closed on Sundays.

faqs.question: What insurance do you accept?
faqs.answer: We accept most major insurance providers including Blue Cross Blue Shield, Aetna, Cigna, UnitedHealthcare, Medicare, Medicaid, Humana, and Kaiser Permanente. We also welcome self-pay patients.

faqs.question: Do you accept Medicare?
faqs.answer: Yes, we accept Medicare and Medicaid. Please bring your insurance card to your appointment.

faqs.question: What payment methods do you accept?
faqs.answer: We accept cash, credit cards, debit cards, HSA, FSA, and checks. We also offer payment plans for uninsured patients.

faqs.question: How does billing work?
faqs.answer: We bill your insurance directly. Co-pays and deductibles are due at the time of your visit. For uninsured patients, we offer payment plans to make care accessible.

faqs.question: What should I bring to my first visit?
faqs.answer: Please bring: photo ID, insurance card (front and back), list of current medications, any previous medical records, and a referral letter if required. Arrive 15 minutes early to complete paperwork.

faqs.question: What documents do I need for my appointment?
faqs.answer: For your first visit, bring photo ID, insurance card, medication list, and any medical records. For follow-ups, bring your insurance card if it changed and any new test results.

faqs.question: Should I arrive early?
faqs.answer: Yes! For first visits, please arrive 15 minutes early to complete paperwork. For follow-up appointments, arriving 5-10 minutes early is sufficient.

faqs.question: What is your cancellation policy?
faqs.answer: Please cancel or reschedule at least 24 hours in advance. Cancellations with less than 24 hours notice or no-shows may result in a $50 fee. Call us if you have special circumstances.

faqs.question: Is there a fee for missing my appointment?
faqs.answer: Yes, there's a $50 fee for no-shows without notice. However, we understand emergencies happen - please call us to discuss special circumstances.

faqs.question: How do I cancel or reschedule my appointment?
faqs.answer: You can cancel or reschedule by calling us at +1-555-123-4567, replying to your confirmation email, or through this chat. Please provide at least 24 hours notice.

faqs.question: What if I'm running late?
faqs.answer: We have a 15-minute grace period. If you'll be more than 15 minutes late, please call ahead. We may need to reschedule to ensure quality care for all patients.

faqs.question: What are your COVID-19 protocols?
faqs.answer: We have modified protocols: masks are optional but available, hand sanitizer stations throughout, enhanced cleaning between patients, and telehealth options for non-emergency visits.

faqs.question: Do I need to wear a mask?
faqs.answer: Masks are optional but available upon request. We have hand sanitizer stations and maintain enhanced cleaning protocols.

faqs.question: Do you offer telehealth appointments?
faqs.answer: Yes! We offer telehealth/video visits for non-emergency appointments. Just let us know when scheduling and we'll set you up with a virtual visit.

faqs.question: How long is a general consultation?
faqs.answer: A general consultation is 30 minutes. Follow-up visits are 15 minutes, physical exams are 45 minutes, and specialist consultations are 60 minutes.

faqs.question: What types of appointments do you offer?
faqs.answer: We offer: General Consultations (30 min), Follow-up visits (15 min), Physical Exams (45 min), and Specialist Consultations (60 min).

faqs.question: Do you handle emergencies?
faqs.answer: For medical emergencies, please call 911 or go to the nearest emergency room. For urgent but non-emergency issues, call our office and we'll try to fit you in same-day.

faqs.question: How can I contact the clinic?
faqs.answer: Call us at +1-555-123-4567, email appointments@healthcareplus.com, or use this chat to schedule appointments. For urgent matters, please call.
